## The Problem {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Why Eviction Prediction Matters**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Leads to housing instability and negative health outcomes
- Perpetuates poverty and community disinvestment
- Current response is **reactive** — too late

[**Who is Affected?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Low-income renters
- Rent-burdened households (30%+ income on rent)
- Predominantly Black neighborhoods
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**The Decision We Inform**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Where to deploy emergency rental assistance
- Which tracts need proactive outreach
- How to allocate limited city resources

<br>

[**Goal:** Shift from reactive to **proactive** intervention]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## The Solution {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**What We're Predicting**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Monthly eviction filing counts by census tract
- Identify spots for resource targeting

[**How Prediction Helps**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Identify high-risk tracts **before** spikes occur
- Enable proactive deployment of resources
- Target outreach to **prevent** evictions
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Better Than Current Practice**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Current Approach | Our Model |
|:-----------------|:----------|
| Wait → React | Predict → Intervene early |
| Resources spread thin | Targeted allocation |
| Help comes too late | Prevention-focused |

[**Goal:** Early intervention prevents displacement]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Data Sources & Integration {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Primary Data**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **Eviction Lab** (2020–2023): Monthly filing counts
- **ACS 5-Year Census**: Demographics, housing, income
- **Dewey Rental Data**: Monthly median rent
- **BLS**: Unemployment, wages, CPI

[**Spatial Features**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Economic activity density (KDE from OSM POIs)
- Neighborhood income quantiles
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Panel Structure**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **Unit**: Census tract × month
- **Time Period**: 2020–2023 (48 months)
- **Validation**: 10-fold cross-validation

[**Key Variables**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Demographics: % Black, % renter
- Economic: Median income, weekly wages
- Housing: Median rent, % rent burdened
- Temporal: Year FE, moratorium, unemployment lag
:::
:::

## Exploratory Analysis: Temporal Patterns {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="55%"}
![](image asset/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width="100%"}
:::

::: {.column width="45%"}
[**Key Finding: Moratorium Effect**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Filings dropped to **near-zero** Apr–Jun 2020
- CDC + local Emergency Housing Protection Act
- PHA moratorium through March 2021

[**Post-Moratorium Surge**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Surged past pre-pandemic levels by mid-2022
- Peaked August 2022, stabilized in 2023

[**Takeaway:** Prevention policies work]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

## Model {background-color="#ffffff"}

We have four different regression models in total, with a very complicated process building and analyzing the models. Equation and table below display the logic of our model building process.

<br>

$$\text{Eviction} = \text{Census Characteristics} + \text{Temporal Characteristics} + \text{Spatial Characteristics}$$

<br>

| Characteristic Type | Variables |
|:--------------------|:----------|
| Census Characteristics | Income, race, renters characteristics, median rent (monthly), unit characteristics |
| Temporal Characteristics | Year, season, policy indicators, CPI, Unemployment rate, wages |
| Spatial Characteristics | Neighborhood effects, EconKDE |

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Model Performance {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**10-Fold CV Results**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Model | RMSE | R² | MAE |
|:------|:-----|:---|:----|
| 1 (Poisson) | 2.354 | 0.324 | 1.613 |
| 2 (NB) | 2.363 | 0.321 | 1.617 |
| 3 (+ Econ) | 2.299 | 0.360 | 1.580 |
| **4 (Full)** | **2.257** | **0.355** | **1.548** |

[Model 4 achieves best RMSE & MAE]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Key Predictors (Model 4)**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **% Renter (+0.020)** — more renters = more filings
- **% Rent burdened (+0.002)** — housing stress
- **% Black (+0.010)** — systemic disparities
- **Unemployment lag (+0.058)** — delayed economic effect
- **Current unemployment (−0.255)** — immediate effect negative
- **Moratorium (−0.189)** — 17% fewer filings
- **Post-moratorium (−0.310)** — 27% fewer filings
- **Log median rent (−0.107)** — wealthier tenants
- **Economic density (−5,422)** — better job access
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Model Performance: Error Analysis {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="55%"}
![](image asset/unnamed-chunk-30-1.png){width="100%"}

[Prediction Errors by Census Tract]{style="font-size: 0.9em; color: #64748b;"}
:::

::: {.column width="45%"}
[**Where Does the Model Struggle?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Higher errors (purple) scattered across the city
- Some concentration in **South Philly** and **West Philly**
- Lower errors in **Far Northeast** and parts of **North Philly**

[**Why These Patterns?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- High-variability tracts harder to predict
- May need additional spatial features

[**Equity Concern:** Less accurate where help is needed most]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Error Patterns by Demographics {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="55%"}
![](image asset/unnamed-chunk-33-1.png){width="100%"}

[Errors vs. Demographic Characteristics]{style="font-size: 0.9em; color: #64748b;"}
:::

::: {.column width="45%"}
[**Systematic Patterns**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- **Higher income** → slightly lower errors
- **Higher % Black** → slightly higher MAE
- **Higher % renter** → increased errors
- **Higher rent burden** → slightly increased errors

[**Implication**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Model performs better in higher income tracts
- Communities most in need face less accuracy

[**Raises equity concerns about deployment**]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::
------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Limitations & Bias {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Technical Limitations**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Model **underpredicts** in high-eviction tracts
- Trained on 2020–2023 (COVID-influenced)
- Spatial autocorrelation suggests missing features

[**Data Gaps**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- ACS 5-year estimates limit granularity
- Dewey = listing prices, not actual rents
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Bias Concerns**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Worse in low-income, Black, rent-burdened areas
- May **underallocate** to those most in need

[**Who Could Be Harmed?**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Flagged tracts may face stigmatization
- Landlords could misuse scores

[**Need clear governance for accountability**]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Implementation Recommendation {background-color="#ffffff"}

::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Monthly Risk Score Dashboard**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

| Risk Tier | Action |
|:----------|:-------|
| High | Deploy emergency rental assistance |
| Medium | Proactive tenant outreach |
| Low | Monitor & update monthly |

[**User-Facing Tools**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Emergency Rental Assistance Application program
- Coordinate with courts to flag high-risk cases

[**Data Already Available**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

Court filings, Census demographics, BLS indicators
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
[**Required Safeguards**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Human review of all allocation decisions
- Regular audits for disparate impact
- Transparent methodology — residents should know how scores are calculated
- Clear governance framework for accountability

[**Key Benefits**]{style="color: #1d4ed8;"}

- Early intervention **before** displacement
- Efficient, targeted resource allocation
- Data-driven but human-supervised

[**Prevention over reaction**]{style="color: #be185d; font-weight: bold;"}
:::
:::
